com.philips.lighting.hue.sdk

Class PHHueSDK

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.philips.lighting.hue.sdk.PHHueSDK

  • public class PHHueSDK
extends java.lang.Object
    This class manages hue SDK operations. SDK can be used as shown in this diagram.

    Create SDK:
    Create a SDK object for using.
    Register SDK Listener
    Register PHSDKListener object with PHNotificationManager. Applications won't get notifications without registration.
    Search Bridge
    Hue SDK provides a service to search the access points in the network using getSDKService(byte).
    Connect to Bridge
    User connects to a bridge using connect(PHAccessPoint). The bridge will need authentication(push link) if the device is connecting to the bridge for first time.
    Communicate with Bridge
    After connecting to PHAccessPoint, a PHBridge is available for to communicate with bridge. PHBridge provides API to interact with bridge.
    Destroy SDK
    The singleton PHHueSDK object needs to be destroyed before exiting application. It is preferable to finish all bridge communications gracefully before exiting or destroying SDK.

    The above described functions are realized through call backs and state as described below.

      • getSDKService

        public java.lang.Object getSDKService(byte msgType)
        Returns a handle to the requested hue SDK service. Currently types are : SEARCH_BRIDGE A PHBridgeSearchManager for handling bridge search. LOG A PHLog for logging
        Parameters:
        msgType - the service name.
        Returns:
        hue SDK service object.

      • enableHeartbeat

        public void enableHeartbeat(com.philips.lighting.model.PHBridge bridge,
                   long time)
        Enables heartbeat for requested bridge to receive the full configuration with time interval in milliseconds. Delay should be greater or equal to 250ms to start the heartbeat. For more advanced configuration options (e.g Start heartbeat for just lights and groups) use getHeartbeatManager()
        Parameters:
        bridge - the PHBridge object.
        time - the tick time in millisecond.

      • disableHeartbeat

        public void disableHeartbeat(com.philips.lighting.model.PHBridge bridge)
        Disables the full configuration heartbeat for the requested bridge. This method is only applicable if the full configuration heartbeat is running. To disable heartbeat for other types (e.g lights or groups) use getHeartbeatManager()
        Parameters:
        bridge - PHBridge object.

      • disableAllHeartbeat

        public void disableAllHeartbeat()
        Stops all running heartbeats for all bridges.

      • isHeartbeatEnabled

        public boolean isHeartbeatEnabled(com.philips.lighting.model.PHBridge bridge)
        Returns the status of heartbeat for requested bridge.
        Parameters:
        bridge - the PHBridge object.
        Returns:
        true if heartbeat running, false otherwise.

      • connect

        public void connect(PHAccessPoint accessPoint)
             throws com.philips.lighting.hue.sdk.exception.PHHueException
        Connects to a access point.
        Parameters:
        accessPoint - the PHAccessPoint object to connect.
        Throws:
        com.philips.lighting.hue.sdk.exception.PHHueException - when application tries to connect to the access point which is already connected.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • disconnect

        public boolean disconnect(com.philips.lighting.model.PHBridge bridge)
                   throws com.philips.lighting.hue.sdk.exception.PHHeartbeatException
        Disconnects the application from the bridge. Heartbeat needs to be disabled before disconnecting a bridge.
        Parameters:
        bridge - the PHBridge object to disconnect.
        Returns:
        true if bridge is not null and removed successfully.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - the heartbeat to the specified bridge should be stopped before disconnecting the bridge. Otherwise PHHeartbeatException is thrown.
        com.philips.lighting.hue.sdk.exception.PHHeartbeatException

      • startPushlinkAuthentication

        public void startPushlinkAuthentication(PHAccessPoint accessPoint)
        Allows user to authenticate by pressing link button of the bridge within 30 second.
        Parameters:
        accessPoint - the out parameter PHAccessPoint.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if accessPoint is null

      • stopPushlinkAuthentication

        public boolean stopPushlinkAuthentication()
        Allows the user to cancel the Pushlink authentication. For example, if pushlink authentication screen is showing and a user presses the back-key on their Android app. If successfully stopped then no more 'link button not pressed' onError messages will appear in @link PHSDKListener.
        Returns:
        true if pushlink timer was stopped successfully stopped, otherwise false.

      • destroySDK

        public void destroySDK()
        Cleans up resources held by the SDK. Should be called by the application when it is exiting.
